013package org.apache.juneau.cp;
014
015import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.Visibility.*;
017import java.util.*;
018import java.util.function.*;
019
020import org.apache.juneau.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
024
025/**
026 * Utility class for creating beans through constructors, creator methods, and builders.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * Uses a {@link BeanStore} to find available ways to construct beans via injection of beans from the store.
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * This class is instantiated through the following method:
033 * <ul class='javatree'>
034 *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanStore}
035 *       <ul class='javatreec'>
036 *          <li class='jm'>{@link BeanStore#createBean(Class)}
037 *       </ul>
038 *    </li>
039 * </ul>
040 *
041 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
042 * <p class='bjava'>
043 *    <jc>// Construct and throw a RuntimeException using a bean store.</jc>
044 *    <jk>throw</jk> BeanStore
045 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
046 *       .build()
047 *       .addBean(Throwable.<jk>class</jk>, <jv>cause</jv>)
048 *       .addBean(String.<jk>class</jk>, <jv>msg</jv>)
049 *       .addBean(Object[].<jk>class</jk>, <jv>args</jv>)
050 *       .createBean(RuntimeException.<jk>class</jk>)
051 *       .run();
052 * </p>
053 *
054 * <p>
055 * Looks for the following methods for creating a bean:
056 * <ol class='spaced-list'>
057 *    <li>Looks for a singleton no-arg method of the form:
058 *       <p class='bjava'>
059 *    <jk>public static</jk> MyClass <jsm>getInstance</jsm>();
060 *       </p>
061 *       <ul>
062 *          <li>Deprecated and {@link BeanIgnore @BeanIgnore-annotated} methods are ignored.
063 *    </ul>
064 *    <li>Looks for a static creator method of the form:
065 *       <p class='bjava'>
066 *    <jk>public static</jk> MyClass <jsm>create</jsm>(<ja>&lt;args&gt;</ja>);
067 *       </p>
068 *       <ul>
069 *          <li>All arguments except {@link Optional} and {@link List} parameters must have beans available in the store.
070 *          <li>If multiple methods are found, the one with the most matching parameters is used.
071 *          <li>Deprecated and {@link BeanIgnore @BeanIgnore-annotated} methods are ignored.
072 *       </ul>
073 *    <li>Looks for a public constructor of the form:
074 *       <p class='bjava'>
075 *    <jk>public</jk> MyClass(<ja>&lt;args&gt;</ja>);
076 *       </p>
077 *       <ul>
078 *          <li>All arguments except {@link Optional} and {@link List} parameters must have beans available in the store.
079 *          <li>If multiple methods are found, the one with the most matching parameters is used.
080 *          <li>Deprecated and {@link BeanIgnore @BeanIgnore-annotated} methods are ignored.
081 *    </ul>
082 *    <li>Looks for a protected constructor of the form:
083 *       <p class='bjava'>
084 *    <jk>protected</jk> MyClass(<ja>&lt;args&gt;</ja>);
085 *       </p>
086 *       <ul>
087 *          <li>All arguments except {@link Optional} and {@link List} parameters must have beans available in the store.
088 *          <li>If multiple methods are found, the one with the most matching parameters is used.
089 *          <li>Deprecated and {@link BeanIgnore @BeanIgnore-annotated} methods are ignored.
090 *    </ul>
091 *    <li>Looks for a static no-arg create method that returns a builder object that can be passed in to a protected constructor.
092 *       <p class='bjava'>
093 *    <jk>public static</jk> MyClass.Builder <jsm>create</jsm>();
094 *
095 *    <jk>protected</jk> MyClass(MyClass.Builder <jv>builder</jv>);
096 *       </p>
097 *       <ul>
098 *          <li>Deprecated and {@link BeanIgnore @BeanIgnore-annotated} methods are ignored.
099 *    </ul>
100 * </ol>
101 *
102 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
103 *    <li class='note'>The {@link #builder(Class,Object)} method can be used to set an existing initialized builder object to pass to a constructor.
104 *    <li class='note'>An existing initialized builder can be set using the {@link #builder(Class,Object)} method.
105 * </ul>
106 *
107 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
108 *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanStore}
109 * </ul>
110 *
111 * @param <T> The bean type being created.
112 */
113public class BeanCreator<T> {
114
115   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
116   // Static
117   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
118
119   /**
120    * Shortcut for calling <c>BeanStore.INSTANCE.createBean(beanType)</c>.
121    *
122    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
123    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
124    * @return A new creator.
125    */
126   public static <T> BeanCreator<T> of(Class<T> beanType) {
127      return BeanStore.INSTANCE.createBean(beanType);
128   }
129
130   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
131   // Instance
132   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
133
134   private final BeanStore store;
135   private ClassInfo type;
136   private Object builder;
137   private T impl;
138   private boolean silent;
139
140   /**
141    * Constructor.
142    *
143    * @param type The bean type being created.
144    * @param store The bean store creating this creator.
145    */
146   protected BeanCreator(Class<T> type, BeanStore store) {
147      this.type = ClassInfo.of(type);
148      this.store = BeanStore.of(store, store.outer.orElse(null));
149   }
150
151   /**
152    * Allows you to specify a subclass of the specified bean type to create.
153    *
154    * @param value The value for this setting.
155    * @return This object.
156    */
157   public BeanCreator<T> type(Class<?> value) {
158      type = ClassInfo.of(value);
159      return this;
160   }
161
162   /**
163    * Allows you to specify a subclass of the specified bean type to create.
164    *
165    * @param value The value for this setting.
166    * @return This object.
167    */
168   public BeanCreator<T> type(ClassInfo value) {
169      return type(value == null ? null : value.inner());
170   }
171
172   /**
173    * Allows you to specify a specific instance for the build method to return.
174    *
175    * @param value The value for this setting.
176    * @return This object.
177    */
178   public BeanCreator<T> impl(T value) {
179      impl = value;
180      return this;
181   }
182
183   /**
184    * Adds an argument to this creator.
185    *
186    * @param <T2> The parameter type.
187    * @param beanType The parameter type.
188    * @param bean The parameter value.
189    * @return This object.
190    */
191   public <T2> BeanCreator<T> arg(Class<T2> beanType, T2 bean) {
192      store.add(beanType, bean);
193      return this;
194   }
195
196   /**
197    * Suppresses throwing of {@link ExecutableException ExecutableExceptions} from the {@link #run()} method when
198    * a form of creation cannot be found.
199    *
200    * @return This object.
201    */
202   public BeanCreator<T> silent() {
203      silent = true;
204      return this;
205   }
206
207   /**
208    * Specifies a builder object for the bean type.
209    *
210    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
211    *    <li class='note'>When specified, we don't look for a static creator method.
212    * </ul>
213    *
214    * @param <B> The class type of the builder.
215    * @param type The class type of the builder.
216    * @param value The value for this setting.
217    * @return This object.
218    */
219   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
220   public <B> BeanCreator<T> builder(Class<B> type, B value) {
221      builder = value;
222      Class<?> t = value.getClass();
223      do {
224         store.add((Class<T>)t, (T)value);
225         t = t.getSuperclass();
226      } while(t != null && ! t.equals(type));
227      return this;
228   }
229
230   /**
231    * Same as {@link #run()} but returns the alternate value if a method of creation could not be found.
232    *
233    * @param other The other bean to use.
234    * @return Either the created or other bean.
235    */
236   public T orElse(T other) {
237      return execute().orElse(other);
238   }
239
240   /**
241    * Same as {@link #run()} but returns the value wrapped in an {@link Optional}.
242    *
243    * @return A new bean wrapped in an {@link Optional}.
244    */
245   public Optional<T> execute() {
246      return Utils.opt(silent().run());
247   }
248
249   /**
250    * Creates the bean.
251    *
252    * @return A new bean.
253    * @throws ExecutableException if bean could not be created and {@link #silent()} was not enabled.
254    */
255   public T run() {
256
257      if (impl != null)
258         return impl;
259
260      if (type == null)
261         return null;
262
263      Value<String> found = Value.empty();
264
265      // Look for getInstance(Builder).
266      if (builder != null) {
267         MethodInfo m = type.getPublicMethod(
268            x -> x.isStatic()
269            && x.isNotDeprecated()
270            && x.hasNumParams(1)
271            && x.getParam(0).canAccept(builder)
272            && x.hasReturnType(type)
273            && x.hasNoAnnotation(BeanIgnore.class)
274            && x.hasName("getInstance")
275         );
276         if (m != null)
277            return m.invoke(null, builder);
278      }
279
280      // Look for getInstance().
281      if (builder == null) {
282         MethodInfo m = type.getPublicMethod(
283            x -> x.isStatic()
284            && x.isNotDeprecated()
285            && x.hasNoParams()
286            && x.hasReturnType(type)
287            && x.hasNoAnnotation(BeanIgnore.class)
288            && x.hasName("getInstance")
289         );
290         if (m != null)
291            return m.invoke(null);
292      }
293
294      if (builder == null) {
295         // Look for static creator methods.
296
297         Match<MethodInfo> match = new Match<>();
298
299         // Look for static creator method.
300         type.forEachPublicMethod(x -> isStaticCreateMethod(x), x -> {
301            found.set("STATIC_CREATOR");
302            if (hasAllParams(x))
303               match.add(x);
304         });
305
306         if (match.isPresent())
307            return match.get().invoke(null, getParams(match.get()));
308      }
309
310      if (type.isInterface()) {
311         if (silent)
312            return null;
313         throw new ExecutableException("Could not instantiate class {0}: {1}.", type.getName(), "Class is an interface");
314      }
315
316      if (type.isAbstract()) {
317         if (silent)
318            return null;
319         throw new ExecutableException("Could not instantiate class {0}: {1}.", type.getName(), "Class is abstract");
320      }
321
322      // Look for public constructor.
323      Match<ConstructorInfo> constructorMatch = new Match<>();
324      type.forEachPublicConstructor(x -> true, x -> {
325         found.setIfEmpty("PUBLIC_CONSTRUCTOR");
326         if (hasAllParams(x))
327            constructorMatch.add(x);
328      });
329
330      // Look for protected constructor.
331      if (! constructorMatch.isPresent()) {
332         type.forEachDeclaredConstructor(ConstructorInfo::isProtected, x -> {
333            found.setIfEmpty("PROTECTED_CONSTRUCTOR");
334            if (hasAllParams(x))
335               constructorMatch.add(x);
336         });
337      }
338
339      // Execute.
340      if (constructorMatch.isPresent())
341         return constructorMatch.get().invoke(getParams(constructorMatch.get()));
342
343      if (builder == null) {
344         // Look for static-builder/protected-constructor pair.
345         Value<T> value = Value.empty();
346         type.forEachDeclaredConstructor(x -> x.hasNumParams(1) && x.isVisible(PROTECTED), x -> {
347            Class<?> pt = x.getParam(0).getParameterType().inner();
348            MethodInfo m = type.getPublicMethod(y -> isStaticCreateMethod(y, pt));
349            if (m != null) {
350               Object builder = m.invoke(null);
351               value.set(x.accessible().invoke(builder));
352            }
353         });
354         if (value.isPresent())
355            return value.get();
356      }
357
358      if (silent)
359         return null;
360
361      String msg = null;
362      if (found.isEmpty()) {
363         msg = "No public/protected constructors found";
364      } else if (found.get().equals("STATIC_CREATOR")) {
365         msg = "Static creator found but could not find prerequisites: " + type.getPublicMethods().stream().filter(x -> isStaticCreateMethod(x)).map(x -> getMissingParams(x)).sorted().collect(joining(" or "));
366      } else if (found.get().equals("PUBLIC_CONSTRUCTOR")) {
367         msg = "Public constructor found but could not find prerequisites: " + type.getPublicConstructors().stream().map(x -> getMissingParams(x)).sorted().collect(joining(" or "));
368      } else {
369         msg = "Protected constructor found but could not find prerequisites: " + type.getDeclaredConstructors().stream().filter(ConstructorInfo::isProtected).map(x -> getMissingParams(x)).sorted().collect(joining(" or "));
370      }
371      throw new ExecutableException("Could not instantiate class {0}: {1}.", type.getName(), msg);
372   }
373
374   /**
375    * Converts this creator into a supplier.
376    *
377    * @return A supplier that returns the results of the {@link #run()} method.
378    */
379   public Supplier<T> supplier() {
380      return ()->run();
381   }
382
383   private boolean isStaticCreateMethod(MethodInfo m) {
384      return isStaticCreateMethod(m, type.inner());
385   }
386
387   private boolean isStaticCreateMethod(MethodInfo m, Class<?> type) {
388      return m.isStatic()
389         && m.isNotDeprecated()
390         && m.hasReturnType(type)
391         && m.hasNoAnnotation(BeanIgnore.class)
392         && (m.hasName("create") || m.hasName("builder"));
393   }
394
395   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
396   // Helpers
397   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
398
399   static class Match<T extends ExecutableInfo> {
400      T executable = null;
401      int numMatches = -1;
402
403      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
404      void add(T ei) {
405         if (ei.getParamCount() > numMatches) {
406            numMatches = ei.getParamCount();
407            executable = (T)ei.accessible();
408         }
409      }
410
411      boolean isPresent() {
412         return executable != null;
413      }
414
415      T get() {
416         return executable;
417      }
418   }
419
420   private boolean hasAllParams(ExecutableInfo ei) {
421      return store.hasAllParams(ei);
422   }
423
424   private Object[] getParams(ExecutableInfo ei) {
425      return store.getParams(ei);
426   }
427
428   private String getMissingParams(ExecutableInfo ei) {
429      return store.getMissingParams(ei);
430   }
431}
